intro: Corytoplectus latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf corytoplectus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
